p: Given the host inflammatory response to SARS-CoV-2, immune-based therapy is recommended for the treatment of moderate to severe cases of COVID-19 [ 123]. Immunomodulatory agents are used as therapy for dysregulated innate immune responses to SARS-CoV-2 infection. Currently recommended agents include corticosteroids, interleukin inhibitors, IFNs, and tyrosine kinase inhibitors [ 123, 125, 126]. In clinical trials, combination therapies are used for the treatment of COVID-19. For instance, patients treated with a triple combination of IFNÎ²-1b, lopinavir-ritonavir, and ribavirin showed faster viral clearance and more rapid clinical improvement compared with the control group [ 127].
